title: Buy Star Health; target of Rs 520: Motilal Oswal
content: Motilal Oswal's research report on Star Health Star Health (STARHEAL) has reported lower growth than its SAHI peers, which has led to market share loss for the company in the health segment to 11.4% (YTDFY26) vs. 15.7% in FY21. However, we believe that a pickup in fresh premium growth recently should help the company sustain its market share. Its retail health performance has been lower than the industry level due to lower retention after price hikes and intensifying competition, which led to market share erosion. Its exit from group health accounts has lowered the diversification opportunities for the company. Multiple rounds of repricing done last year, along with annual price hikes expected this year, will help in managing the claims ratio. However, the company’s aging back book will keep the claims ratio elevated. STARHEAL’s expense ratios have improved consistently (30.8% in FY25 from 30.2% in FY24), despite strong new business growth. While the commission ratios will remain elevated due to rising share of fresh business (15% in FY26/FY27), operational efficiency will aid improvement in opex ratio (15.4%/14.6% in FY26/FY27). Outlook We expect a CAGR of 14%/8% in IGAAP GWP/PAT over FY25-27E, with the combined ratio improving to 98.6% in FY27E. We maintain BUY rating on the stock with a TP of INR520 (valuing the company at 29x FY27E P/E). For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Star Health - 26082025 - moti

title: Linde India shares surge 3.22% amid high volume
content: Shares of Linde India gained 3.22% to trade at Rs 6,498.00 in Tuesday's session, witnessing a surge in trading volume. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, Linde India has demonstrated the following performance. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 571.08 Crore, compared to Rs 653.23 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 105.07 Crore, down from Rs 111.54 Crore year-over-year. The EPS stood at Rs 12.57 in June 2025, compared to Rs 13.33 in June 2024. title: Subscribe for Vikran Engineering Ltd IPO; Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey, Vikran Engineering Ltd Vikran Engineering Ltd, is an Indian Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) company, capable of providing end-to-end services, having a diversified project portfolio including presence across multiple sectors such as power, water and railway. Its offerings includes end-toend services from conceptualization, design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning of turnkey projects. The Company has a deep expertise in executing projects across power transmission & distribution, underground and surface water systems, solar EPC projects, smart metering, and traction substation works. Its key differentiator is its strong in-house design and engineering capabilities and proven project execution efficiency. With a track record of delivering projects to government entities, PSUs, and private companies, the firm focuses on operational excellence and cost efficiency while maintaining high regulatory and quality standards. Valuation and Outlook Vikran’s initial issue is available at 17.3x TTM EV/EBITDA which is much lower to its peer average of 32.0x TTM EV/EBITDA. We believe the issue is attractively priced, as its growth in terms of revenue and EBITDA, has trended in a similar range of its peers, while it is available at a much lower valuation. We assign a “SUBCRIBE” rating to the issue. title: Subscribe for Vikran Engineering Ltd IPO; Ajcon Global
content: Ajcon Global, Vikran Engineering Ltd Vikran Engineering Ltd. (VEL) is a fast-growing Indian Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) company in terms of revenue growth for FY23-25, when compared to industry growth estimates and the peer set under consideration. While its revenue from operations is smaller than that of its listed industry rivals, it has grown at a CAGR of 32.17%, according to Restated Financial Information. It has a diverse project portfolio, with the majority of revenue coming from energy and water infrastructure verticals. The company offers turnkey services ranging from conceptualization to design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning, and operates in a variety of industries such as power, water, and railway infrastructure. Within the power industry, VEL operates in both power transmission and power distribution. Its water-related projects include subterranean and surface water delivery, overhead tanks, and distribution networks. The company also has experience with solar EPC for ground-mounted solar systems and smart metering. Valuation and Outlook The Indian Infrastructure and Renewable Energy sectors are expanding rapidly, fueled by increased government investments in water supply, energy transition, railways, and urban development projects. Within this space, Vikrant Engineering has a strong execution track record, having completed 45 projects worth Rs. 1,920 crore and an active order book of Rs.2,442 crore across 16 states. At the upper price band of Rs.97, the issue is valued at a P/E multiple of ~32.12x on its FY25 EPS of Rs. 3.02 post IPO. We give a ‘SUBSCRIBE’ rating to the issue for the following reasons. title: Pharma stocks fall up to 3% after Trump promises to significantly cut drug prices in US
content: The shares of pharma companies dropped in trade on August 26 after US President Donald Trump said that he will reduce drug prices in US by a whopping "1,400-1,500 percent". He also reiterated his threat to slap higher tariffs on pharma imports. The Nifty Pharma index dropped more than 1.2 percent to hover around 22,082, as seen at around 11.22 am. The index has now snapped a three-session gaining streak. Trump had earlier sent letters to major drug makers, demanding them to lower drug prices in US and bring them in-line with what other nations are paying for new medicines. The letters were sent to Eli Lilly, Novo Nordisk, Pfizer and others, demanding that Most Favored Nation (MFN) pricing be implemented by September 29. In the letter, Trump issued a 60-day ultimatum to companies to voluntarily comply to the new pricing diktat, failing which US will deploy 'every tool in our arsenal' in order to protect Americans from 'continued abusive drug pricing' practices. Companies will also have to offer certain medicines directly to patients at prices at which they are offered to third-party insurers, Trump's letters said. A 1,500 percent reduction in drug prices will make exports practically impossible to US. Pharma stocks tumbled after Trump's fresh threats. Zydus Life shares were the top loser on the index, dropping more than 3.5 percent to trade at Rs 987 apiece. Sun Pharma and Lupin shares dropped more than 2 percent each. Notably, BofA Securities has downgraded Sun Pharma shares to 'underperform' from its earlier 'neutral' rating, and cut its target price for the stock to Rs 1,570 apiece, CNBC-TV18 reported. This implies a downside potential of more than 5 percent from the previous closing price of Rs 1,656.70 apiece. The international brokerage cited potential risk to Sun Pharma's consensus earnings and its premium valuations are key reasons for the downgrade, as per the report. Aurobindo Pharma, IPCA Labs, Natco Pharma, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Torrent Pharma and Ajanta Pharma shares fell over 1 percent each, while Cipla, Divi's Laboratories, Mankind Pharma, Laurus Labs and Glenmark Pharma were down up to 1 percent each. Bucking the trend, Granules and Abbott India shares were up 2 percent and 1 percent respectively. title: Subscribe for Vikran Engineering Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Vikran Engineering Ltd Incorporated in 2008, headquarters in Thane, Maharashtra Vikran Engineering is specializing in turnkey infrastructure projects across power transmission, water supply, and railway electrification. It provides end-to-end services including design, supply, installation, testing, and commissioning and has successfully completed or is executing critical projects like high-voltage substations up to 765 kV, eagle-eyed water systems under Jal Jeevan Mission, railway electrification, and metro infrastructure across 14–16 states, showcasing both breadth and depth of execution capability substations up to 400 kV, and power distribution networks. It has also executed 30,000 smart metering connections. Its clients in the government sector include NTPC, Power Grid Corporation of India, among others. As of June 30, 2025, the company has successfully completed 45 projects across 14 states with a total executed contract value of ₹19,199 million. As of the same date, the company had 44 ongoing projects across 16 states, aggregating orders of ₹51,202 million, of which the unexecuted order book stood at ₹24,424 million. Valuation and Outlook On the valuation front, based on annualized FY25 earnings, the company is seeking a P/E of 32.1 times, and a post-issue market capitalization of approximately Rs 25,017 million, making the issue appear fully priced. With a consistent track record of executing large-scale projects along with asset-light model for marquee government and public sector clients and PAN India presence, Vikran Engineering Limited is well-positioned to capitalize on opportunities in the high-growth infrastructure sector. Considering its scalability, financial strength, and sectoral tailwinds, we assign a ‘Subscribe for Long term’ rating for the IPO For all IPO report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Vikran Engineering -260825 - anand

title: Sundaram Finance shares rise 2.06% in morning trade
content: Shares of Sundaram Finance gained 2.06% to trade at Rs 5,073 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top gainers on Nifty Midcap 150. On the financial front, the consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,348.93 Crore, compared to Rs 1,951.60 Crore in June 2024, marking a significant increase. The net profit for the same period was Rs 411.80 Crore, as against Rs 402.19 Crore in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 43.12 in June 2025, compared to Rs 39.46 in June 2024. The consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 8,485.63 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 7,267.12 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 1,812.81 Crore, up from Rs 1,422.43 Crore in March 2024. The EPS increased to Rs 170.53 in March 2025, compared to Rs 130.31 in March 2024. title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2.61%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Sun Pharma declined 2.61% to Rs 1,613.40 in Tuesday's session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other top losers on Nifty 50 included Shriram Finance, Tata Steel, Dr Reddys Labs and Coal India. Quarterly Financial Performance: The consolidated quarterly revenue for Sun Pharma has shown an increasing trend. For the quarter ending June 2024, the revenue was Rs 12,652.75 Crore, which increased to Rs 13,291.39 Crore for September 2024, Rs 13,675.46 Crore for December 2024, and Rs 12,958.84 Crore for March 2025. The latest quarter ending June 2025, shows a revenue of Rs 13,851.40 Crore. Net profit also reflects fluctuations across the quarters. The net profit stood at Rs 2,871.25 Crore for June 2024, increased to Rs 3,030.67 Crore in September 2024, then slightly decreased to Rs 2,917.54 Crore in December 2024, and dropped to Rs 2,160.64 Crore in March 2025. However, it recovered to Rs 2,302.62 Crore for the quarter ending June 2025. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) values align with the net profit trend, with values of Rs 11.80, Rs 12.70, Rs 12.10, Rs 9.00, and Rs 9.50 for the quarters from June 2024 to June 2025, respectively.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 12,652.75 CroreRs 13,291.39 CroreRs 13,675.46 CroreRs 12,958.84 CroreRs 13,851.40 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,871.25 CroreRs 3,030.67 CroreRs 2,917.54 CroreRs 2,160.64 CroreRs 2,302.62 CroreEPSRs 11.80Rs 12.70Rs 12.10Rs 9.00Rs 9.50Annual Financial Performance: The consolidated annual revenue for Sun Pharma has consistently increased over the years. In 2021, the revenue was Rs 33,498.14 Crore, which grew to Rs 38,654.49 Crore in 2022, Rs 43,885.68 Crore in 2023, Rs 48,496.85 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 52,578.44 Crore in 2025. The net profit also shows a strong growth trend. Starting from Rs 2,284.68 Crore in 2021, it increased to Rs 3,405.82 Crore in 2022, surged to Rs 8,560.84 Crore in 2023, further rose to Rs 9,648.44 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. The EPS (Earnings Per Share) reflects this growth, with values of Rs 12.10, Rs 13.60, Rs 35.30, Rs 39.90, and Rs 45.60 for the years 2021 through 2025, respectively. The BVPS (Book Value Per Share) has also increased steadily, from Rs 206.23 in 2021 to Rs 301.00 in 2025. The ROE (Return on Equity) remained relatively stable, fluctuating between 6.24% in 2021 and 15.13% in 2025. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained low, indicating a conservative capital structure, with values ranging from 0.07 in 2021 to 0.03 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 33,498.14 CroreRs 38,654.49 CroreRs 43,885.68 CroreRs 48,496.85 CroreRs 52,578.44 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,284.68 CroreRs 3,405.82 CroreRs 8,560.84 CroreRs 9,648.44 CroreRs 10,980.10 CroreEPSRs 12.10Rs 13.60Rs 35.30Rs 39.90Rs 45.60BVPSRs 206.23Rs 212.84Rs 247.22Rs 265.36Rs 301.00ROE6.24%6.81%15.13%15.04%15.13%Debt to Equity0.070.020.110.040.03Annual Income Statement: The sales for Sun Pharma have shown consistent growth over the past five years. title: UNO Minda share price hits all-time high; gains 0.71%
content: Shares of UNO Minda reached an all-time high of Rs 1,294.00 on the NSE in Tuesday's session. The stock is currently trading at Rs 1,292.50, a gain of 0.71% from its previous close, as of 10:50 am. UNO Minda is included as one of the stocks in the Nifty Midcap 150 index. title: Vodafone Idea shares plummet 10% amid high volume; among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea were trading at Rs 6.67 on the NSE at 10:13 am, a steep decline of 9.86% from its previous close. The stock is currently among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150, experiencing a surge in trading volume. The high volume suggests a notable increase in trading activity for Vodafone Idea shares, coinciding with the significant price decrease.Financial SnapshotHere is a summary of Vodafone Idea's consolidated financial performance:Consolidated Quarterly ResultsKey financial figures for the recent quarters are as follows:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 10,508.30 CroreRs 10,932.20 CroreRs 11,117.30 CroreRs 11,013.50 CroreRs 11,022.50 CroreNet Profit-Rs 6,432.20 Crore-Rs 7,175.60 Crore-Rs 6,609.30 Crore-Rs 7,168.10 Crore-Rs 6,608.10 CroreEPS-1.02-1.03-0.95-1.01-0.63The consolidated quarterly results reveal a fluctuating revenue trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 stood at Rs 10,508.30 Crore, increasing to Rs 11,022.50 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025, representing a 4.9% increase. However, the company has consistently reported net losses across all quarters, with a net loss of Rs 6,608.10 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025.Consolidated Yearly ResultsThe consolidated yearly financial performance is detailed below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 41,952.20 CroreRs 38,515.50 CroreRs 42,177.20 CroreRs 42,651.70 CroreRs 43,571.30 CroreNet Profit-Rs 44,464.50 Crore-Rs 28,246.60 Crore-Rs 29,301.60 Crore-Rs 31,232.90 Crore-Rs 27,385.20 CroreEPS-15.40-9.83-8.43-6.41-4.01BVPS-13.30-19.29-15.28-20.78-9.85ROE0.000.000.000.000.00Debt to Equity-4.12-3.08-0.18-1.99-2.79The consolidated annual revenue has demonstrated a gradual increase, from Rs 41,952.20 Crore in 2021 to Rs 43,571.30 Crore in 2025, marking a 3.86% growth over the five-year period. Despite this revenue growth, the company has consistently reported net losses. The net loss for 2025 was Rs 27,385.20 Crore, compared to Rs 44,464.50 Crore in 2021. The debt-to-equity ratio for the year-ending March 2025 is -2.79.Income StatementThe following table presents an overview of the company's consolidated income statement:Mar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021SalesRs 43,571 CroreRs 42,651 CroreRs 42,177 CroreRs 38,515 CroreRs 41,952 CroreOther IncomeRs 1,020 CroreRs 113 CroreRs 311 CroreRs 129 CroreRs 174 CroreTotal IncomeRs 44,591 CroreRs 42,764 CroreRs 42,488 CroreRs 38,644 CroreRs 42,126 CroreTotal ExpenditureRs 47,417 CroreRs 47,403 CroreRs 48,432 CroreRs 45,899 CroreRs 68,613 CroreEBITRs -2,825 CroreRs -4,638 CroreRs -5,943 CroreRs -7,254 CroreInterestRs 24,543 CroreRs 25,765 CroreRs 23,354 CroreRs 20,980 CroreRs 17,998 CroreTaxRs 15 CroreRs 828 CroreRs 3 CroreRs 11 CroreRs -20 CroreNet ProfitRs -27,385 CroreRs -31,232 CroreRs -29,301 CroreRs -28,246 CroreRs -44,464 CroreCorporate ActionsVodafone Idea Limited convened its Annual General Meeting on August 25, 2025. The transcript of the Analyst/Investor call, which took place on August 18, 2025, to discuss the company's financial results for the quarter-ending June 30, 2025, is publicly available. Additionally, an audio recording of the earnings call held on the same date is also accessible. Historically, Vodafone Idea has announced final dividends. For instance, on April 28, 2016, a final dividend of Rs 0.60 per share was declared. Similar announcements were made on April 28 of 2015, 2014, and 2013. On January 23, 2019, Vodafone Idea announced a rights issue with a rights ratio of 87:38. The face value was Rs 10, with a premium of Rs 3. The ex-rights date for this issue was March 29, 2019, and the record date was April 02, 2019. A Moneycontrol analysis conducted on August 20, 2025, indicated a bearish sentiment surrounding the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 6.67, Vodafone Idea experienced a significant decline amid high trading volume, reflecting the bearish sentiment.

title: Bharti Airtel share price falls 1.11% in morning trade
content: Shares of Bharti Airtel were trading lower in Tuesday's session. As of 10:30 am, the stock was priced at Rs 1,909.20 on the NSE, a decline of 1.11% from the previous close. Earlier in the trading session, the stock touched a high of Rs 1,925.80 and a low of Rs 1,900.10. Financial Overview The following tables provide a comprehensive look at Bharti Airtel's financial performance, covering both quarterly and annual results. These include key metrics such as revenue, net profit, and earnings per share (EPS). Consolidated Quarterly Results The consolidated quarterly results show a fluctuating but generally increasing trend in revenue. Revenue increased from Rs 38,506.40 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 49,462.60 Crore in June 2025. Net profit saw a significant rise in December 2024 and March 2025 before decreasing to Rs 7,339.00 Crore in June 2025. EPS also reflects this volatility, peaking in December 2024 and then declining.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 38,506.40 CroreRs 41,473.30 CroreRs 45,129.30 CroreRs 47,876.20 CroreRs 49,462.60 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,805.80 CroreRs 3,079.50 CroreRs 14,474.90 CroreRs 12,418.10 CroreRs 7,339.00 CroreEPS7.216.2125.5419.0210.26Consolidated Yearly Results The consolidated yearly results demonstrate consistent growth in revenue, which increased from Rs 100,615.80 Crore in 2021 to Rs 172,985.20 Crore in 2025. Net profit shows a recovery from a loss of Rs -23,327.90 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 33,778.30 Crore in 2025. EPS has also improved significantly, from Rs -27.65 in 2021 to Rs 58.00 in 2025.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 100,615.80 CroreRs 116,546.90 CroreRs 139,144.80 CroreRs 149,982.40 CroreRs 172,985.20 CroreNet ProfitRs -23,327.90 CroreRs 5,882.00 CroreRs 11,535.30 CroreRs 5,848.60 CroreRs 33,778.30 CroreEPS-27.657.6714.8013.0958.00BVPS147.90164.46210.95216.40226.16ROE-25.586.399.197.3925.58Debt to Equity2.202.001.821.501.13The annual income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 172,985 Crore, other income of Rs 1,573 Crore, and total income of Rs 174,558 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 118,109 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 56,449 Crore. Interest payments amounted to Rs 21,753 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 917 Crore. The net profit for the year stood at Rs 33,778 Crore. In comparison to the year ending March 2024, sales increased from Rs 149,982 Crore to Rs 172,985 Crore, demonstrating a growth in revenue. Similarly, net profit significantly increased from Rs 5,848 Crore to Rs 33,778 Crore. The quarterly income statement for June 2025 shows sales of Rs 49,462 Crore, other income of Rs 508 Crore, and total income of Rs 49,971 Crore. Total expenditure was Rs 34,089 Crore, resulting in an EBIT of Rs 15,882 Crore. Interest payments amounted to Rs 5,460 Crore, and tax expenses were Rs 3,082 Crore. The net profit for the quarter stood at Rs 7,339 Crore. In comparison to the quarter ending June 2024, sales increased from Rs 38,506 Crore to Rs 49,462 Crore, indicating a substantial growth in quarterly revenue. According to the cash flow statement, the net cash flow as of March 2025 is Rs 1,600 Crore compared to Rs 30 Crore in March 2024. Cash flow from operating activities is Rs 98,332 Crore, from investing activities is Rs -60,269 Crore, and from financing activities is Rs -36,533 Crore. The balance sheet shows that as of March 2025, the share capital is Rs 2,900 Crore and reserves & surplus is Rs 128,275 Crore. Current liabilities amount to Rs 180,440 Crore and other liabilities are Rs 202,744 Crore, with total liabilities reaching Rs 514,360 Crore. On the assets side, fixed assets are valued at Rs 347,769 Crore, current assets at Rs 67,588 Crore, and other assets at Rs 99,001 Crore, with total assets also at Rs 514,360 Crore. Key Financial Ratios Key financial ratios for Bharti Airtel include a debt-to-equity ratio of 1.13 as of March 2025. The basic EPS is Rs 58.00 and diluted EPS is Rs 56.04 for the year ending March 2025. The book value per share is Rs 226.16. The company's dividend per share is Rs 16.00, with a face value of Rs 5. The return on net worth/equity is 25.58%. Corporate Announcements Bharti Airtel has made several announcements recently. On August 25, 2025, the company released a press release titled ''Nxtra by Airtel releases Sustainability Report for FY 2024-25'' through its subsidiary, Nxtra Data Limited. Nxtra Data Limited also released its Sustainability Report 2025. Additionally, the company made a disclosure under Regulation 30 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 on August 13, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 16.00 per share (320%) on May 13, 2025, effective July 18, 2025. Other recent dividends include Rs 8.00 per share (160%) announced on May 14, 2024, effective August 7, 2024, and Rs 4.00 per share (80%) announced on May 16, 2023, effective August 11, 2023. Bharti Airtel had a rights issue with an ex-rights date of September 27, 2021, where the rights ratio was 1:14, face value was Rs 5, and the premium was Rs 530. Another rights issue occurred on April 23, 2019, with a rights ratio of 19:67, face value of Rs 5, and premium of Rs 215. A stock split was announced on April 29, 2009, with an ex-split date of July 24, 2009, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split into a new face value of Rs 5. A Moneycontrol analysis as of August 19, 2025, indicates a bullish sentiment on the stock. With the stock currently trading at Rs 1,909.20, Bharti Airtel reflects a dynamic interplay of market movements and corporate actions.

title: Auto, metal, real estate stocks drop up to 2% on Trump tariff worries
content: The shares of auto, metal and real estate companies dropped in trade on August 26, after Donald Trump-led US administration issued a draft order over the implementation of additional 25 percent tariff on Indian imports, effectively from August 27 (Wednesday). The sharp drop in the share prices pushed the sectoral indices, as well as the overall market, down. Nifty Metal and Nifty Realty indices fell more than 1.2 percent and nearly 1.6 percent to hover around 9,319 and 902 respectively. Nifty Auto meanwhile was down over 0.6 percent in the morning. According to a draft notice released by US Department of Homeland Security, the additional tariffs will cover Indian products "that are entered for consumption, or withdrawn from warehouse for consumption, on or after 12:01 a.m. eastern daylight time on August 27, 2025". The notice cited "threats to the United States by the Government of the Russian Federation" as the reason for President Donald Trump's executive order dated August 6. The ties between New Delhi and Washington soured after Trump announced that he will hike the tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent, allegedly in response to New Delhi's continued purchases of Russian oil and defence equipment. Top losers on metal index: Several metal companies have strong export exposure to the US, and will likely be impacted by Trump's tariffs. On the metal index, Adani Enterprises shares were the top loser, dropping more than 2 percent to trade at Rs 2,253 apiece. Welspun Corp, Steel Authority of India (SAIL) and Tata Steel shares fell nearly 2 percent each. Hindalco Industries, National Aluminium Company (NALCO), Hindustan Copper, NMDC and JSW Steel shares fell more than 1 percent each, while Vedanta and Hindustan Zinc shares were down nearly 1 percent. Jindal Stainless Steel shares were trading in the red with marginal losses. Top losers on realty index: While real estate companies are mostly domestic market-oriented, Trump tariffs can inflate the cost of raw materials associated with the industry, which in turn may put pressure on the margins of these companies. On the realty index, heavyweight DLF was the top loser, dropping more than 2 percent to trade at Rs 755 apiece. Macrotech Developers (Lodha), Godrej Properties, Sobha and Oberoi Realty shares fell nearly 2 percent each. Prestige Estates, Raymond, Anant Raj, Phoenix and Brigade Enterprises shares fell around 1 percent each. Top losers on auto index: Several automakers and auto-parts makers derive major portion of their revenue from exports to US. While some auto and auto parts exports are exempt from the latest tariff change, the overall impact on the industry and uncertain trade rules may have pushed the stocks down. Samvardhana Motherson and Bharat Forge shares dropped more than 2 percent, leading losses on the auto index. Balkrishna Industries, MRF and Tube Investments of India shares fell around 1.5 percent each. TVS Motor, Ashok Leyland, Bosch and Maruti Suzuki shares were down up to 1 percent. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates

title: Sun Pharma shares fall 2.59%; stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Sun Pharma declined 2.59% to Rs 1,613.80 in Tuesday's trading session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other top losers on Nifty 50 included Adani Enterprises, Shriram Finance, Adani Ports and Dr Reddy's Labs at 10:00 am. Financial Highlights Sun Pharma's financial performance shows a fluctuating quarterly trend. Revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 13,851.40 Crore, compared to Rs 12,958.84 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit for the same period was Rs 2,302.62 Crore and Rs 2,160.64 Crore respectively. The company’s EPS was Rs 9.50 for June 2025, down from Rs 11.80 in June 2024. The annual consolidated revenue for fiscal year 2025 was Rs 52,578.44 Crore, an increase from Rs 48,496.85 Crore in 2024. The annual net profit increased from Rs 9,648.44 Crore in 2024 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025. EPS also rose from Rs 39.90 in 2024 to Rs 45.60 in 2025. Key financial ratios show a P/E ratio of 38.04 and a P/B ratio of 5.77 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.03 as of the year-ending March 2025.Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)202133,498.142,284.6812.10202238,654.493,405.8213.60202343,885.688,560.8435.30202448,496.859,648.4439.90202552,578.4410,980.1045.60The company's revenue has increased by 56.95% in 2025 compared to 2021. Net profit has increased significantly from Rs 2,284.68 Crore in 2021 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in 2025, indicating strong growth over the past five years. EPS has also shown a consistent increase, reflecting enhanced profitability per share.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20249,604.982,029.4753.82Sep 202410,089.542,149.8956.93Dec 202410,698.313,245.2686.35Mar 202511,454.232,139.3911.40Jun 202511,536.322,155.2011.48The company’s dividend history includes a final dividend of Rs 5.50 per share (550%) which was effective from July 7, 2025. Additionally, an interim dividend of Rs 10.50 per share (1050%) was effective from February 6, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates bearish sentiment on the stock as of August 21, 2025.

title: Nestle shares rise 1.25%; stock among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Nestle gained 1.25 percent today, and were trading at Rs 1,167.40 at 10 am. The stock is among the top gainers on the Nifty 50. Other top gainers on Nifty 50 include Hindustan Unilever (HUL), TCS, Bajaj Auto and Infosys. Nestle Financial Overview Nestle's financial performance reveals key insights based on consolidated data. The quarterly revenue saw fluctuations, with a recent figure of Rs 5,096.16 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2025. Net profit for the same period stood at Rs 659.23 Crore, and the Earnings Per Share (EPS) was reported as Rs 6.71. Here is a detailed table of Nestle's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 4,813.95 CroreRs 5,104.00 CroreRs 4,779.73 CroreRs 5,503.88 CroreRs 5,096.16 CroreNet ProfitRs 746.60 CroreRs 903.21 CroreRs 695.82 CroreRs 885.88 CroreRs 659.23 CroreEPS7.749.337.149.066.71The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,096.16 crore compared to Rs 4,813.95 crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit stood at Rs 659.23 crore in the quarter-ending June 2025, lower than Rs 746.60 crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS also decreased from 7.74 in the quarter-ending June 2024 to 6.71 in the quarter-ending June 2025. Nestle's annual financial data provides further context. For the year-ending 2025, the revenue was Rs 20,201.56 Crore, with a net profit of Rs 3,231.54 Crore and an EPS of Rs 33.27. The Book Value Per Share (BVPS) was Rs 41.59, and the Return on Equity (ROE) was 79.98. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.19. The following table summarizes Nestle's yearly financial performance:Heading20242025RevenueRs 24,393.89 CroreRs 20,201.56 CroreNet ProfitRs 3,932.84 CroreRs 3,231.54 CroreEPS40.7933.27BVPS34.6541.59ROE117.7179.98Debt to Equity0.010.19The revenue decreased by 17.23% from Rs 24,393.89 crore in 2024 to Rs 20,201.56 crore in 2025. Similarly, the net profit also declined by 17.83%, from Rs 3,932.84 crore in 2024 to Rs 3,231.54 crore in 2025. The EPS decreased from 40.79 to 33.27, while the BVPS increased from 34.65 to 41.59. The ROE decreased from 117.71 to 79.98, and the debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.01 to 0.19. Corporate Actions Nestle India Limited has been actively involved in corporate actions. On August 11, 2025, the company informed the exchange regarding the allotment of 964,157,160 bonus equity shares with a face value of Re. 1 each. The company announced a bonus issue on June 26, 2025, with an existing and offered ratio of 1:1 and ex-date as August 08, 2025. Furthermore, dividends were declared, with the latest final dividend announced on April 24, 2025, at Rs 10.00 per share (1000%) with a record date of July 04, 2025. Conclusion Nestle's stock performance and financial health indicate a strong market presence, supported by recent gains and consistent financial activities.

Key bonus announcements include:Bonus Ratio: 1:1, Ex-Bonus Date: May 31, 2018Bonus Ratio: 1:1, Ex-Bonus Date: June 16, 2009Bonus Ratio: 1:1, Ex-Bonus Date: July 28, 2006In conclusion, Tata Consultancy Services shows a marginal increase in share price and remains among the top gainers on Nifty 50. The stock is currently trading at Rs 3,146.00.

title: Rail Vikas Nigam shares fall 2.32% in early trade
content: Shares of Rail Vikas Nigam experienced a decline of 2.32% in early trading, with the stock price at Rs 314.20. title: Yes Bank share price falls 2.05% in early trade
content: Yes Bank shares experienced a decline of 2.05% in early trading, with the stock price falling to Rs 19.15. Yes Bank stock is a constituent of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. The quarterly financial performance of Yes Bank reveals the following trends in consolidated results: The revenue for Yes Bank has shown slight fluctuations over the past five quarters, with a marginal decrease from Rs 7,725 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 7,604 Crore in June 2025. Over the same period, the net profit increased steadily from Rs 516 Crore to Rs 808 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) also rose consistently from 0.17 in June 2024 to 0.26 in June 2025, reflecting improved profitability. The consolidated yearly financials provide additional context on Yes Bank's performance: The annual revenue has increased steadily, from Rs 20,039 Crore in 2021 to Rs 30,918 Crore in 2025. The net profit has also seen a significant turnaround, from a loss of Rs 3,489 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 2,447 Crore in 2025. Key metrics such as EPS, BVPS, ROE, and NIM have also improved, indicating enhanced financial health. Additionally, the income statement provides a detailed breakdown of Yes Bank's annual financial activities, including interest earned, other income, total income, total expenditure, and various profit measures. For the year ending March 2025, interest earned stood at Rs 30,918 Crore, and net profit was Rs 2,447 Crore. The income statement also presents data related to Non-Performing Assets (NPAs), with Gross NPA at Rs 3,935 Crore and Net NPA at Rs 800 Crore as of March 2025. The balance sheet for the same period shows total liabilities of Rs 424,115 Crore and total assets of Rs 424,115 Crore, reflecting the bank's financial structure and stability. Corporate actions for Yes Bank include disclosures under Regulation 30 of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015, and intimations regarding shareholder communications and allotment of equity shares pursuant to stock options under YBL ESOS 2020 Scheme. The last split was announced on 2017-07-26, with old FV of 10 and new FV of 2 with exsplit date of 21 Sep, 2017.

title: Dixon Technologies stock falls 2.30%, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 in early trade
content: Shares of Dixon Technologies declined by 2.30% to Rs 16,627.00 in Tuesday's session. The stock is among the top losers on Nifty Midcap 150 at 9:48 am. Financial Snapshot: Dixon Technologies' consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 12,835.66 Crore, up from Rs 6,579.80 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 273.26 Crore, compared to Rs 132.26 Crore in the same quarter last year. title: Titan Company shares slip even as Bernstein initiates coverage with outperform call; 15% upside seen
content: Shares of Titan Company slipped almost a percent to Rs 3,627 in morning deals on Tuesday, August 26, even as Bernstein initiated coverage with an outperform rating on the stock, citing positive levers for growth. The drop comes amid a weak market mood after Donald Trump signalled an additional 25 percent tariff on India. The international brokerage has assigned a price target of Rs 4,200 per share. This implies an upside potential of 15 percent from the last closing price of Rs 3,651. The brokerage pointed to Titan’s strong legacy of delivering 23 percent EPS CAGR over the past two decades, while also highlighting that the stock currently trades at a five-year low valuation. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Despite challenges from higher gold prices, intensifying competition, and shifts in natural versus lab-grown diamond dynamics, Bernstein projects an 18 percent revenue CAGR and 25 percent EBIT CAGR between FY25 and FY28. The jeweller and watchmaker reported a 34 percent increase in standalone net profit at Rs 1,030 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The firm reported a standalone net profit of Rs 770 crore in the year-ago period. The firm's bottom line exceeded estimates as a Moneycontrol poll of five brokerages pegged it at Rs 893 crore. The firm's standalone revenue rose 21 percent to Rs 14,564 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 12,053 crore a year ago. The Tata group company said the watches business had an 'exceptional' quarter, recording a growth of 24 percent over Q1FY25, achieving a total income of Rs 1,273 crore. EBIT came in at Rs 287 crore, clocking a 22.6 percent margin for Q1FY26. At about 9:45 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 3,636, lower by 0.4 percent from the last close on the NSE. Titan Company shares have risen 12 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sun Pharmaceutical Industries shares fall 2.29% in early trade
content: Shares of Sun Pharmaceutical Industries declined by 2.29% to Rs 1,618.70 in Tuesday's early trading session. A Moneycontrol analysis as of August 21, 2025 reflects a bearish sentiment on Sun Pharma stock. Financial Highlights Sun Pharmaceutical Industries' financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past few years. The consolidated revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 52,578.44 Crore, compared to Rs 48,496.85 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Net profit also increased from Rs 9,648.44 Crore in March 2024 to Rs 10,980.10 Crore in March 2025. The quarterly performance also reveals a positive trend. Revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 was Rs 13,851.40 Crore, up from Rs 12,652.75 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 2,302.62 Crore, slightly down from Rs 2,871.25 Crore in June 2024. title: Vodafone Idea shares slumps 9% after govt clarifies no fresh discussion on AGR relief
content: Shares of Vodafone Idea is witnessing a serious bout of profit booking, down over 9 percent in early trade on August 26, taking Indus Towers' shares along with it, as investors likely offloaded positions after clarification from the Telecom Ministry on the company's AGR dues. Minister of State for Communications Pemmasani Chandra Sekhar had told Moneycontrol on August 25 that there is no plan under consideration to extend further relief other than what has been already extended. “...we have recently converted a lot of their debt into equity. Government has done whatever we thought we could do and at this time we don’t have any discussion or plan to change other than what we have done,” the minister said. Any additional relief for Vodafone Idea (Vi) on its adjusted gross revenue (AGR) dues will be decided collectively by the Union Cabinet, involving the Prime Minister’s Office (PMO), Finance Ministry, Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia and the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), the minister added. Shares of Indus Tower are down 3.5 percent in early trade on August 26, but are flat on a YTD basis. Shares of Vodafone Idea are down over 15 percent on a YTD basis. Last week, a news report had suggested that the DoT has proposed “multiple relief options” to the PMO, including a fresh two-year moratorium on AGR payments, smaller annual instalments, and waivers on penalties and interest. Asked if the PMO had received a proposal from DoT on extending relief to the operator, Sekhar replied: “not that we know of.” On the question of survival, the minister responded, “That is not up to me to decide… every company, all the companies, are continuously reaching out for various reasons, they will also be continuously reaching. But at this time, the discussion — there is nothing that we have planned.” Vi had previously urged DoT to treat the Rs 17,213 crore (principal calculated till FY19) as final, and waive off the entire interest and penalty on AGR dues. Akshaya Moondra, the CEO of Vodafone Idea had told analysts during an investor call earlier this month that the company is entirely focusing on investing in the business. "...whatever capital is available to the Company, the focus is not in trying to do anything with the government holding. The focus will be in using any funding and cash generation for investments, which will give the best returns for the business." The telecom player is engaged with banks for funding, which have started moving forward. The banks are currently looking for some clarity on the AGR front, Voda Idea has said, hence the company is engaged with the government. "In the past, we have always seen that government has been supportive. You look at 2019 deferment of spectrum instalments, 2021 Reforms Package, 2023 conversion of government dues to equity, 2025 again, conversion of government dues to equity. Generally, these actions have happened. Generally, they happen closer to the time when it is essentially needed. Our request to the government has been that let us resolve this earlier than before the deadline of March, so thatbanks get clarity and we can proceed with bank funding," Akshaya Moondra had told investors during the June quarter earnings call.

title: BSE Limited share price falls 2.44% in early trade
content: Shares of BSE Limited declined by 2.44% to Rs 2,234.80 in early trade. At 9:35 am, the stock showed a significant dip compared to its previous close, reflecting early market volatility. BSE Limited is included as one of the stocks in the NIFTY MIDCAP 150 index. Financial Performance: The consolidated financial performance of BSE Limited reveals the following trends: Quarterly Results: For the quarter-ending June 2025, revenue stood at Rs 1,037.45 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 670.64 Crore in June 2024. Net profit for the same period was Rs 521.88 Crore, compared to Rs 241.56 Crore in the previous year. The EPS stood at Rs 13.09. Annual Results: The annual revenue for March 2025 was Rs 3,212.04 Crore, significantly higher than Rs 1,592.50 Crore in March 2024. Net profit also saw substantial growth, reaching Rs 1,234.47 Crore, up from Rs 699.84 Crore. EPS increased to Rs 96.55 in March 2025 from Rs 56.66 in March 2024. The total liabilities amounted to Rs 10,341 Crore, and total assets were also valued at Rs 10,341 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow from operating activities for March 2025 was Rs 414 Crore. The net cash flow was Rs -550 Crore. Ratios: Key financial ratios for BSE Limited show a basic EPS of Rs 96.55 and diluted EPS of Rs 96.55. The company reported a book value per share of Rs 326.84 and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions: BSE Limited announced a bonus issue with a ratio of 2:1, with the ex-bonus date as May 23, 2025. The company also announced dividends, including a final dividend of Rs 18 per share and a special dividend of Rs 5 per share to commemorate the 150th year of BSE Ltd, both effective from May 14, 2025. Shares of BSE Limited witnessed a decline in the early trading session, influenced by overall market dynamics and recent financial announcements.

title: Max Healthcare Institute shares fall 2.06% in early trade
content: Shares of Max Healthcare Institute Limited declined by 2.06% to Rs 1,196.20 in early trade. At 09:28 am, the stock reflected a negative trend on the exchanges. On the financial front, the consolidated quarterly revenue for Max Healthcare Institute has shown consistent growth. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2024 was Rs 1,542.95 Crore, which increased to Rs 1,707.46 Crore for September 2024, Rs 1,868.31 Crore for December 2024, and further to Rs 1,909.74 Crore for March 2025. The latest quarter-ending June 2025 saw revenue reaching Rs 2,027.57 Crore. Net profit also experienced fluctuations across the quarters. It stood at Rs 236.27 Crore for June 2024, increased to Rs 281.81 Crore in September 2024, then slightly decreased to Rs 238.80 Crore in December 2024, before rising again to Rs 319.00 Crore in March 2025. For the quarter-ending June 2025, the net profit was Rs 307.97 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) followed a similar trend, with values of Rs 2.43 for June 2024, Rs 2.90 for September 2024, Rs 2.46 for December 2024, Rs 3.28 for March 2025, and Rs 3.17 for June 2025.HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 1,542.95 CroreRs 1,707.46 CroreRs 1,868.31 CroreRs 1,909.74 CroreRs 2,027.57 CroreNet ProfitRs 236.27 CroreRs 281.81 CroreRs 238.80 CroreRs 319.00 CroreRs 307.97 CroreEPS2.432.902.463.283.17The consolidated yearly financials reveal a strong growth trajectory. Revenue increased from Rs 2,504.67 Crore in 2021 to Rs 3,931.46 Crore in 2022, Rs 4,562.60 Crore in 2023, Rs 5,406.02 Crore in 2024, and reached Rs 7,028.46 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also shown significant improvement, turning from a loss of Rs -114.50 Crore in 2021 to a profit of Rs 605.05 Crore in 2022, Rs 1,103.51 Crore in 2023, Rs 1,057.64 Crore in 2024, and Rs 1,075.88 Crore in 2025. title: Positive contributors to Nifty 50: HUL, ITC, M&M among top stocks on the index today
content: Positive momentum was observed in the Nifty 50 index during Tuesday's trading session, with several stocks contributing significantly to the index's gains. ITC followed with a 1.38% increase, trading at Rs 399.90. M&M also saw a notable rise of 1.14%, with its shares priced at Rs 3,402.10. Other significant contributors to the Nifty 50 included Bajaj Auto, up 0.78% to Rs 8,770.00, and Titan Company, which increased by 0.63% to Rs 3,653.90. title: Sensex tumbles 600 pts, Nifty below 24,800 as US notifies India of additional tariffs; bank, pharma, metal stocks lead decline
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex fell 0.7 percent each in morning trade on August 26, weighed down by the additional 25% duties on Indian goods scheduled to take effect on August 27. Bank, metal and pharma stocks were major laggards while the mid and smallcaps also mirrored weak trends in early trade. At 10:40 am, the Sensex was down 612.85 points or 0.75 percent at 81,023.06, and the Nifty was down 182.50 points or 0.73 percent at 24,785.25. About 1,028 shares advanced, 2,344 shares declined, and 133 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Earlier this month, Trump said the US would raise tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent from 25 percent, citing New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil. The move is intended to curb India’s energy trade with Moscow and increase pressure on Russia to halt its war in Ukraine. "Despite muted earnings growth and challenges such as high tariffs, Indian equities have held firm, making the market the most expensive globally. While foreign investors have remained steady sellers, strong domestic institutional inflows have more than offset the outflows, keeping sentiment buoyant. With liquidity emerging as the key driver of this resilience—and flows expected to stay strong—analysts believe a sharp correction is unlikely, and elevated valuations could persist," V K Vijayakumar of Geojit Investments Ltd said. Among individual stocks, Sai Life Sciences slipped as much as 4 percent after private equity firm TPG Asia offloaded its entire 15.2 percent holding in the Hyderabad-based CRDMO through block deals, CNBC TV-18 reported. The sale, estimated at nearly Rs 2,810 crore, involves about 3.16 crore shares and carries a floor price of Rs 874 per share, roughly at a 3.5 percent discount from the previous close of Rs 906 per share. Titan shares slipped due to a weak market mood even as Bernstein initiated coverage with an “outperform” rating and a target price of Rs 4,200, citing the company’s strong positioning to benefit from rising formalisation and evolving consumer preferences in India. The brokerage highlighted Titan’s track record of delivering a 23 percent EPS CAGR over the past two decades and noted that the stock is trading at a five-year low valuation. Reliance Industries shares were in focus after UBS resumed coverage on the stock with a “buy” call and a price target of Rs 1,750, implying a 24 percent upside from Monday’s close. The brokerage said RIL is well placed for a re-rating on the back of its value-unlocking prospects and described the conglomerate as a key player shaping India’s digital and new energy future. Technical View With Nifty failing to display directional strength, the index now clings to its crucial support at 24,800. The broader setup between the swing high of 25,150 and swing low of 24,850 indicates limited upside and a prolonged consolidation phase. Renewed call writing at higher strikes, coupled with sustained put additions at similar levels, further validates the sideways structure. Unless the index decisively clears 25,150, upward momentum is likely to remain capped. On the downside, sustaining above 24,800 is critical to prevent deeper corrections. For now, a “sell on rise” approach appears prudent, with traders awaiting a clear breakout above 25,100 or a breakdown below 24,800 for the next directional move. Ahead of the key tariff announcement on the 27th, the market is likely to witness sideways-to-volatile sessions. HUL, Bajaj Auto, TCS and Infosys were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Tata Steel, Dr Reddy's, ICICI Bank, Bharat Electronics, and Hindalco. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Jindal Stainless shares rise 2.02% in early trade
content: Shares of Jindal Stainless gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 812.55 in early trade. The stock demonstrated positive movement in today's session. On the financial front, Jindal Stainless has shown steady growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 10,207.14 Crore, up from Rs 9,429.76 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 728.32 Crore, compared to Rs 647.50 Crore in the previous year. Here is a summary of the company's quarterly financial performance:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 9,429.76 CroreRs 9,776.83 CroreRs 9,907.30 CroreRs 10,198.32 CroreRs 10,207.14 CroreNet ProfitRs 647.50 CroreRs 609.42 CroreRs 668.78 CroreRs 617.94 CroreRs 728.32 CroreEPS7.877.427.957.188.67The company's yearly financial performance also reflects growth. Consolidated revenue for the year-ending March 2025 increased to Rs 39,312.21 Crore from Rs 38,562.47 Crore in March 2024. However, the net profit saw a slight decrease, from Rs 2,640.35 Crore in 2024 to Rs 2,543.42 Crore in 2025. Below is an overview of the company's yearly financials:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 12,188.46 CroreRs 21,223.40 CroreRs 35,697.03 CroreRs 38,562.47 CroreRs 39,312.21 CroreNet ProfitRs 414.25 CroreRs 1,806.44 CroreRs 1,973.87 CroreRs 2,640.35 CroreRs 2,543.42 CroreEPS8.6037.8125.6832.9530.42BVPS66.0599.46145.33174.56202.61ROE13.0736.2717.7218.8915.01Debt to Equity0.970.600.320.410.38The Income statement for the year ending March 2025 shows sales of Rs 39,312 Crore compared to Rs 38,562 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 290 Crore and total income at Rs 39,603 Crore for year ending March 2025. The total expenditure was Rs 35,608 Crore and EBIT stood at Rs 3,994 Crore for the same period. Interest paid was Rs 611 Crore and tax was Rs 839 Crore. The net profit was Rs 2,543 Crore. The income statement for the quarter ending June 2025 shows sales of Rs 10,207 Crore compared to Rs 9,429 Crore for the quarter ending June 2024. Other income stood at Rs 68 Crore and total income at Rs 10,276 Crore for quarter ending June 2025. The total expenditure was Rs 9,149 Crore and EBIT stood at Rs 1,126 Crore for the same period. Interest paid was Rs 144 Crore and tax was Rs 254 Crore. The net profit was Rs 728 Crore. The company’s cash flow from operating activities was Rs 4,718 Crore for the year ending March 2025. Investing activities resulted in an outflow of Rs 3,438 Crore and financing activities led to an outflow of Rs 1,882 Crore. The net cash flow for the year was a negative Rs 600 Crore. Analyzing the balance sheet, the share capital remained constant at Rs 164 Crore between March 2024 and March 2025. Reserves and surplus increased from Rs 14,193 Crore to Rs 16,523 Crore. Total assets and total liabilities both stood at Rs 36,158 Crore as of March 2025. Key financial ratios for Jindal Stainless as of March 2025 include a basic EPS of Rs 30.42 and a diluted EPS of Rs 30.41. The book value per share was Rs 202.61. The company's debt to equity ratio stood at 0.38, and the interest coverage ratio was 8.11. Jindal Stainless announced a final dividend of Rs 2.00 per share (100%) with an effective date of August 22, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 1.00 per share (50%) was announced on January 29, 2025, and was effective from February 7, 2025. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment on the stock as of today. Shares of Jindal Stainless gained 2.02% to trade at Rs 812.55 in early trade, demonstrating positive movement in today's session.

title: Vishal Mega Mart shares rise 2.07% in early trade
content: Vishal Mega Mart shares are trading at Rs 151.97, up 2.07% in Tuesday's session. At 09:18 am, the stock is trading with positive momentum on Nifty Midcap 150. Financial Overview: Consolidated Yearly Figures: Vishal Mega Mart's financial performance shows consistent growth over the past four years. Key highlights include:Revenue: Increased from Rs 5,588.52 Crore in 2022 to Rs 10,716.35 Crore in 2025.Net Profit: Rose from Rs 202.77 Crore in 2022 to Rs 631.97 Crore in 2025.EPS: Increased from Rs 0.45 in 2022 to Rs 1.40 in 2025.The company's book value per share (BVPS) has also grown steadily from Rs 10.71 in 2022 to Rs 13.92 in 2025, and the return on equity (ROE) improved from 4.20% to 9.87% over the same period. The debt-to-equity ratio remained at 0.00 in 2025, indicating a low level of debt. Consolidated Quarterly Figures: The quarterly performance shows a fluctuating but overall positive trend:Revenue: Increased from Rs 2,596.29 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 3,140.32 Crore in June 2025.Net Profit: Rose from Rs 150.15 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 206.07 Crore in June 2025.EPS: Increased from Rs 0.33 in June 2024 to Rs 0.45 in June 2025.Standalone Yearly Figures (Income Statement): The standalone income statement provides additional insights into the company's financial health. Sales increased from Rs 5,619 Crore in March 2023 to Rs 5,946 Crore in March 2025. Net profit also showed growth, increasing from Rs 246 Crore in March 2023 to Rs 472 Crore in March 2025. Standalone Quarterly Figures (Income Statement): The standalone quarterly income statement shows fluctuations in sales and net profit. Sales increased from Rs 1,667 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 1,669 Crore in June 2025. Net profit increased from Rs 130 Crore in June 2024 to Rs 176 Crore in June 2025. Balance Sheet: The company's balance sheet as of March 2025 shows total liabilities of Rs 7,794 Crore and total assets of Rs 7,794 Crore. Key components include share capital of Rs 4,597 Crore and reserves & surplus of Rs 1,598 Crore. Cash Flow: The cash flow statement indicates a net cash flow of Rs 95 Crore as of March 2025. Cash flow from operating activities stood at Rs 493 Crore, while investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of Rs 473 Crore. Financial Ratios: Key financial ratios for Vishal Mega Mart show a P/E ratio of 99.28 and a P/B ratio of 7.73 as of March 2025. The company reported a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.00 as of the year-ending March 2025. The basic EPS stood at Rs 1.05 in March 2025, compared to Rs 0.71 in March 2024 and Rs 0.55 in March 2023. The diluted EPS was Rs 1.02 in March 2025, compared to Rs 0.69 in March 2024 and Rs 0.54 in March 2023. The company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 10,716.35 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 8,911.95 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 631.97 Crore, compared to Rs 461.94 Crore in the year-ending March 2024. The company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 3,140.32 Crore, compared to Rs 2,547.89 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 206.07 Crore, compared to Rs 115.11 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Corporate Actions Vishal Mega Mart Limited informed the exchange regarding the allotment of 7,933,333 shares on August 25, 2025. Additionally, there was an announcement regarding the allotment of 7,933,333 equity shares pursuant to the exercise of stock options on the same day. Moneycontrol analysis indicates a very bullish sentiment for the stock. At 09:18 am, Vishal Mega Mart is trading with positive momentum on Nifty Midcap 150.

title: Sai Life Sciences Block Deal: Shares worth Rs 2,810 crore change hands; TPG Asia likely seller
content: Shares of Sai Life Sciences slipped as much as 4 percent to Rs 871 in morning trade on Tuesday, August 26, after private equity firm TPG Asia offloaded its entire 15.2 percent holding in the Hyderabad-based CRDMO through block deals, CNBC TV-18 reported. The sale, estimated at nearly Rs 2,810 crore, involves about 3.16 crore shares and carries a floor price of Rs 874 per share, roughly at a 3.5 percent discount from the previous close of Rs 906 per share. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Moneycontrol couldn't independently verify the buyers and sellers of the deal. If it is TPG Asia, the move marks a complete exit for the investor at a time when the company has been reporting decent growth across businesses. In the June quarter of FY26, Sai Life swung to a profit of Rs 60 crore from a Rs 13 crore loss a year ago, while revenue from operations surged 77 percent to Rs 496 crore. The CDMO segment led the charge with a 113 percent jump, while Discovery services grew 38 percent. Operating performance too strengthened sharply, with EBITDA rising to Rs 125 crore and margins widening to 25 percent from 11 percent a year earlier, aided by scale and productivity gains. Looking ahead, the company has guided for 15–20 percent annual revenue growth over the next three to five years and aims to lift margins to around 30 percent. At about 9:25 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 873, lower by 3.8 percent from the last close on the NSE. Sai Life shares have been strong recently, rallying over 25 percent in the last three months. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: HAL Offshore Stake in Seamec Rises to 70.59% After 28,000 Share Buy
content: HAL Offshore Limited has increased its stake in Seamec Limited to 70.59%, acquiring 28,000 equity shares through open market purchases on August 25, 2025. The acquisition represents 0.11% of Seamec's total share capital. Prior to this acquisition, HAL Offshore held 1,79,20,406 shares, constituting 70.48% of Seamec Limited's shares. Following the acquisition, HAL Offshore Limited now holds 1,79,48,406 shares. The disclosure was made under Regulation 29(2) of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Substantial Acquisition of Shares and Takeovers) Regulations, 2011. Details of AcquisitionParticularsBefore AcquisitionAcquisitionAfter AcquisitionShares Carrying Voting Rights1,79,20,406 (70.48%)28,000 (0.11%)1,79,48,406 (70.59%) The equity share capital/ total voting capital of Seamec Limited before and after the said acquisition remains at ₹25.425 Crores. The acquisition was executed through the open market. HAL Offshore Limited, along with persons acting in concert (PAC) Mr. Sanjeev Agrawal and Mrs. Deepti Agrawal, executed the acquisition in their capacity as promoters of Seamec Limited. Subrat Das, Chief Financial Officer, signed the release on behalf of HAL Offshore Limited. The acquisition was executed through the open market.

title: Nestle shares among top losers on Nifty 50 on Monday, fall about 0.9%
content: Nestle's stock ended at Rs 1,153.00 on Monday, a decrease of 0.85%. The stock was among the top losers on Nifty 50 in yesterday's session. Nestle India Limited has been actively communicating with investors, as evidenced by the intimation of a one-on-one virtual meeting with an institutional investor on August 20, 2025. Additionally, the company addressed its shareholders through an Extraordinary General Meeting (EGM) held on July 24, 2025, the detailed proceedings of which have been disclosed. On August 11, 2025, Nestle India also announced the allotment of 964,157,160 bonus equity shares, each with a face value of Re. 1. Nestle has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 10 per share (1000%) was announced on April 24, 2025, with an effective date of July 4, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 14.25 per share (1425%) was declared on January 24, 2025, and paid out on February 7, 2025. Looking back to the previous year, a final dividend of Rs 8.50 per share (850%) was announced on April 25, 2024, and an interim dividend of Rs 2.75 per share (275%) was announced on July 8, 2024. The company also has a history of bonus issues, with the most recent one announced on June 26, 2025, in the ratio of 1:1, with a record date of August 8, 2025. A prior bonus issue was announced on April 23, 1996, with a ratio of 1:2, and another on September 30, 1993, with a ratio of 1:4. Nestle split its stock on October 19, 2023, changing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 1, effective January 5, 2024. Here is a summary of Nestle's financial performance:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202424,393.893,932.8440.7934.65117.710.01202520,201.563,231.5433.2741.5979.980.19The annual revenue for March 2025 stood at Rs 20,201.56 Crore, compared to Rs 24,393.89 Crore in March 2024. The net profit decreased from Rs 3,932.84 Crore in 2024 to Rs 3,231.54 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw a decrease, from Rs 40.79 to Rs 33.27. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) increased from Rs 34.65 to Rs 41.59. Return on Equity (ROE) decreased from 117.71% to 79.98%, and the debt-to-equity ratio increased from 0.01 to 0.19.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 20244,813.95746.607.74Sep 20245,104.00903.219.33Dec 20244,779.73695.827.14Mar 20255,503.88885.889.06Jun 20255,096.16659.236.71The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 5,096.16 Crore, compared to Rs 4,813.95 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 659.23 Crore, compared to Rs 746.60 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 6.71, compared to Rs 7.74 for the quarter-ending June 2024. Key financial figures from the balance sheet show that in March 2025, Share Capital remained constant at Rs 96 Crore, while Reserves & Surplus increased to Rs 3,913 Crore from Rs 3,244 Crore the previous year. Total Liabilities also increased, reaching Rs 12,193 Crore from Rs 10,523 Crore in March 2024. Nestle's annual income statement for March 2025 shows sales of Rs 20,201 Crore and other income of Rs 58 Crore, resulting in a total income of Rs 20,260 Crore. Total expenditure amounted to Rs 15,784 Crore, leading to an EBIT of Rs 4,476 Crore. After accounting for interest (Rs 136 Crore) and tax (Rs 1,108 Crore), the net profit stood at Rs 3,231 Crore. Cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 2,936 Crore, while cash flow from investing activities was -Rs 1,810 Crore, and cash flow from financing activities was -Rs 1,848 Crore, resulting in a net cash flow of -Rs 722 Crore. As of March 2025, Nestle has a Debt to Equity ratio of 0.19, and an interest coverage ratio of 35.37. Valuation ratios include a P/E of 33.83, a P/B of 54.12, and an EV/EBITDA of 45.25. Nestle's stock ended at Rs 1,153.00 on Monday, a decrease of 0.85% and among the top losers on Nifty 50.

title: Sensex, Nifty set for a weak start as Trump signals 50% tariffs; key levels to track on August 26
content: Indian equities are set for a cautious start on Tuesday, August 26, after a draft notice revealed US President Donald Trump’s plan to slap 50 percent tariffs on Indian goods. At 8:15 am, the Gift Nifty was quoting at 24,916, down 71 points or 0.31 percent, signalling a weak open for the Sensex and Nifty. Earlier this month, Trump said the US would raise tariffs on Indian goods to 50 percent from 25 percent, citing New Delhi’s purchases of Russian oil. The move is intended to curb India’s energy trade with Moscow and increase pressure on Russia to halt its war in Ukraine. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Equity benchmarks Nifty 50 and Sensex recorded some gains, kicking off the holiday-truncated trading week on a positive note on Monday, August 25. Dovish signals from the U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell raised hopes of a rate cut, fuelling investor optimism across the globe. Here are the important levels to watch out for in today's session With Nifty failing to display directional strength, the index now clings to its crucial support at 24,800. The broader setup between the swing high of 25,150 and swing low of 24,850 indicates limited upside and a prolonged consolidation phase. Renewed call writing at higher strikes, coupled with sustained put additions at similar levels, further validates the sideways structure. Unless the index decisively clears 25,150, upward momentum is likely to remain capped. On the downside, sustaining above 24,800 is critical to prevent deeper corrections. For now, a “sell on rise” approach appears prudent, with traders awaiting a clear breakout above 25,100 or a breakdown below 24,800 for the next directional move. Ahead of the key tariff announcement on the 27th, the market is likely to witness sideways-to-volatile sessions. "On the daily chart, the Nifty Bank index remains below all key moving averages except the 200-day moving average, highlighting that recovery attempts are being capped at higher levels. The index continues to hover close to the recent swing low of 54,905, which is acting as immediate support. A breakdown below this zone could drag the index further toward 54,600, which coincides with the 127.8 percent Fibonacci extension," Om Mehra of SAMCO Securities said. "The broader trend remains fragile as long as the index stays below its short-term averages. Support is placed at 54,900, followed by 54,600, while resistance stays firm at 55,500–55,600. Until the index crosses above these hurdles, short-term moves may remain choppy with risks tilted toward the downside," he added. The India VIX settled at 11.76; however, crossing above 12.50 could lead to higher volatility in the coming sessions. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) dipped further from 0.52 to 0.50, highlighting call-side dominance and supply pressure. At the same time, the oversold PCR also leaves room for a short-term relief pullback. The increasing PCR, or being higher than 0.7 or surpassing 1, means traders are selling more Put options than Call options, which generally indicates the firming up of a bullish sentiment in the market. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by experts on Moneycontrol are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Apollo Hospitals shares fall nearly 0.9% on Monday, among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Apollo Hospitals were among the top losers on the Nifty 50 on Monday. The stock ended at Rs 7,851.00, a decline of nearly 0.9% in yesterday's session. Apollo Hospitals Enterprises Limited has been actively communicating with the Exchange, as indicated by recent press releases and announcements regarding investor meets. Earlier, on August 20, 2025, Apollo Hospitals announced the outcome of an Analyst/Investor Meet. Additionally, on August 14, 2025, the company shared a link to a recording with the Exchange. Apollo Hospital has announced several dividends. A final dividend of Rs 10 per share (200%) was announced on May 30, 2025, with an effective date of August 19, 2025. Prior to that, an interim dividend of Rs 9 per share (180%) was announced on February 10, 2025, effective February 14, 2025. The company's historical corporate actions include a stock split on September 2, 2010, where the face value changed from Rs 10 to Rs 5. A rights issue was announced on September 30, 1993, with an existing ratio of 1:1 and a premium of Rs 10, with ex date of March 10, 1993.Apollo Hospitals Financial PerformanceApollo Hospital's financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit. On a quarterly basis, the company's revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 5,842.10 Crore, compared to Rs 5,085.60 Crore in the quarter-ending June 2024. title: Protean eGov Technologies shares gain 10% on order win of Rs 1,160 crore from UIDAI
content: Protean eGov Technologies share price rose 10 percent in the opening trade on August 26 following the company received a work order from UIDAI to establish district level Aadhar Kendra. At 09:20am, Protean eGov Technologies was quoting at Rs 905.75, up Rs 87.55, or 10.70 percent, on the BSE. ".... has received a work order from Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI), New Delhi, Government of India for providing services as service provider for establishing and running district level Aadhaar Seva Kendra (ASK) of approximately Rs 1160 crores (exclusive of taxes)," company said in its press release. The company is going to establish ASK in 188 districts across India and provide appointment/ walk-in based Aadhaar Enrolment, Update and other miscellaneous Aadhaar Services at ASK in next six years.

title: Signpost India share price gain on advertising contract with Bangalore Metro Rail
content: Signpost India share price gained in the early trade on August 26 following company secured nine-year advertising contract for Bengaluru Metro. At 09:19am, Signpost India was quoting at Rs 288.95, up Rs 3.55, or 1.24 percent, on the BSE. ".... announced a new 9-year exclusive contract with Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) for advertising rights across 67 Namma Metro stations," company said in its exchange filing. This long-term partnership covers over 100000+ sq. ft. of premium media space and holds a revenue potential of up to Rs 700 crore, it added.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a weak start on August 26, tracking GIFT Nifty, which was hovering around 24,928 earlier this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Benchmark indices started the week on a positive note, erasing some of the previous session's losses as IT and metal shares rallied on Federal Reserve Chair Powell's hint on US interest rate trajectory, though the Nifty 50 index continued to face resistance at around 25,000 levels. The index pulled back from the highs of the day, and at close, the Sensex closed up 329.06 points or 0.40 percent at 81,635.91, while the Nifty 50 was up 97.65 points or 0.39 percent at 24,967.75. Broader market indices underperformed key indices, with the BSE Mid and Smallcap indices ending on a flat note. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading lower at around 24,928, indicating a negative start for the day. Asian Equities (Down) Asian markets were trading lower in the early trade on Tuesday, tracking losses on Wall Street, as investors weighed U.S. President Donald Trump’s comments on China. US Equities (Slip) Wall Street stocks ended lower on Monday as investors parsed the outlook for U.S. interest rates and looked ahead to AI chipmaker Nvidia's quarterly earnings this week, while digesting a rally on Friday that lifted the Dow Jones Industrial Average to a record high close. The S&P 500 declined 0.43% to end the session at 6,439.32 points. The Nasdaq declined 0.22% to 21,449.29 points, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average declined 0.77% to 45,282.47 points. US Bond Yield (Mixed) The yield on 10-year Treasuries gained, while on 2-year Treasuries were trading lower on Tuesday after President Donald Trump announced he was removing a Federal Reserve governor, which undermined confidence in U.S. assets. Dollar Index (Down) The dollar slid in Asian trading on Tuesday after President Donald Trump announced he was removing a Federal Reserve governor, which undermined confidence in U.S. assets. Asian currencies (Gain) Asian currencies were trading mostly higher against the US dollar in the early Tuesday trade, with the Indonesian Rupiah leading the gainers, followed by the Japanese Yen, the Philippines Peso, Thai Baht. Crude (Down) Oil prices edged down on Tuesday after surging nearly 2% in the previous session, as traders kept a close watch on developments in the Russia-Ukraine conflict for the potential impact on fuel supplies from the region. Gold (Up) Gold prices were trading higher after President Donald Trump removed Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, raising concerns about the independence of the central bank. Fund Flow Action The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) remained net sellers on the second day on August 25 as they sold equities worth Rs 2466 crore, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) purchased equities worth Rs 3176 crore on the same day. Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead. title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade TCS, Exide Industries, Cipla, Max Financial Services, Hyundai Motor India, Nykaa, and others on August 26?
